Detailed Description

InetSocket is the abstract base class of specific socket implementations. APOXI sockets are based on a BSD socket interface and extend it with functionality like asynchronous event notifications.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef SysSocket::OptionType InetSocket::OptionType [protected]
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum InetSocket::ShutdownMode
 

ShutdownMode specifies how a socket should be shut down.

See also:
Shutdown().
Enumerator:
c_shutdown_stop_rx  Shutdown receiving.
c_shutdown_stop_tx  Shutdown transmitting.
c_shutdown_stop_rx_tx  Shutdown receiving and transmitting.

enum InetSocket::Type
 

Type specifies the socket type requested.

See also:
GetSoTypeOption()
Enumerator:
c_type_dgram  UDP socket.
c_type_stream  TCP socket.
c_type_raw  RAW socket.
c_type_default  The default socket type is UDP.

DataConnProfileId InetSocket::GetDataConnProfileId (   )  const
 

Returns the ID of the data connection (profile) that the socket will use for transferring data.

SocketError InetSocket::GetError (   )  const [inline]
 

If a socket operation failed GetError() returns the cause for the error. The error code is not reset by calling GetError(). As error causes differ between different system socket implementations, a common subset of error codes has been chosen. If c_socket_unknown_error is returned then a system specific error code occurred.

Reimplemented in UdpNetAdapter, and TcpNetAdapter.

INT InetSocket::GetInBufByteCount (   ) 
 

Returns the number of bytes that can be read from the socket.

Returns:
Number of bytes that can be read or -1 on failure.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::HandOver (  InetSocket &  to_socket  )  [protected]
 

Hands over itself to to_socket. This socket is then reverted to closed state and hence does not operate any more. Instead, to_socket continues operation. This method should only be used to hand over a socket between execution contexts if needed. Note that if you hand over a socket from one execution context to another, also the execution context to which to_socket belongs must have initialized a socket handler. For the hand over to succeed this socket must be in open state and to_socket must be in closed state. If the hand over can not be performed FALSE is returned.

See also:
ExecutionContext

SocketHandler

Returns:
Success of hand over.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::IsBlocking (   )  const [virtual]
 

Tells if the socket is in blocking mode.

Implements Socket.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::IsDataConnEstablished (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection has been established according to the data connection profile settings. The data connection does not refer to the connected state of the socket but to if the bearer (data call, GPRS attach, Bluetooth link, etc.) for the data transfer has been setup correctly.

virtual BOOLEAN InetSocket::IsOpen (  void   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Checks if the socket is open.

Implements Socket.

virtual void InetSocket::OnAsyncEvent (  Event  event  )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Receives the notification of an asynchronous event. The event types are dependent on the socket type, some events are only sent for connection oriented sockets or for server sockets (please see the enumeration Event). A client who uses sockets has to derive an own socket class and implement this method in order to listen to the events that occur on the socket and to react on it according to its communication policy.

Reimplemented in FtpDataServerSocket, FtpDataSocket, FtpServerSocket, FtpSocket, HttpServerSocket, HttpSocket, LcsSocket, RegTcpSocket, TcpServerTestSocket, TcpTestSocket, and UdpTestSocket.

virtual void InetSocket::OnControlMsg (  const SocketControlMsg &  msg  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Translates the socket control message msg into a socket event and routes it accordingly. If a listener is set, its OnSocketEvent method is called. Otherwise the messages are discarded.

Reimplemented from Socket.

Implemented in TcpServerSocket, TcpSocket, and UdpSocket.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::Open (  Type  type,
const InetSocketAddr *  local_addr,
BOOLEAN  may_reuse_addr
)  [protected]
 

Opens the socket. No operations on a socket are allowed unless it has been opened before. After closing the socket, the socket must be opened again to use it again.

INT InetSocket::Read (  void *  buf,
INT  buflen,
InetSocketAddr *  from
)  [protected]
 

Reads data from the socket. For connectionless sockets (UDP) the from parameter may be specified for retrieving the source address. For connection-oriented sockets (TCP) parameter from has to be 0.

Returns:
Number of bytes read or -1 on failure.

Reimplemented in UdpNetAdapter, TcpNetAdapter, and UdpSocket.

void InetSocket::ResetDataConnIdleTimer (   )  const [protected]
 

Resets the idle timer of the associated data connection. If there is activity on this socket then the idle timer of the data connection must be reset.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetBlocking (  BOOLEAN  block = FALSE  )  [virtual]
 

Enables/disables blocking mode on sockets. Changing blocking mode with pending Read() or Write() requests may produce unpredictable results. Using APOXI sockets in blocking mode is depreciated, APOXI sockets default to non-blocking mode. Socket events are sent to the socket independent of the blocking mode.

Implements Socket.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetBoolOption (  OptionType  type,
BOOLEAN  val
)  [protected]
 

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetDataConnProfileId (  DataConnProfileId  id  )  const
 

Sets the ID of the data connection (profile) that the socket will use for transferring data. Changing the data connection (profile) ID on an active (i.e. connected) socket may cause unpredictable results.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetError (  SocketError  err  )  [inline, protected]
 

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetError (  BOOLEAN  ok  )  [inline, protected]
 

void InetSocket::SetReadEventNotification (  BOOLEAN  enable  ) 
 

Enables or disables the read notification mechanism (enabled per default). If enabled socket activity on the read-FD_SET is notified by OnAsyncEvent() to the user. Based on the socket type the event can be incoming data, close of connection, etc.. If disabled, no asynchronous event based on the read-FD_SET will be fired at all.

Please note: If the sockets are used in the recommended way, there is no need to use this method.

BOOLEAN InetSocket::SetSoBroadcastOption (  BOOLEAN  broadcast  )  [inline]
 

Sets the socket broadcast option. This option allows the transmission of broadcast messages on the socket.

buflen Length of write buffer.

Implements Socket.

Reimplemented in TcpSocket, and LcsSocket.

INT InetSocket::Write (  const void *  buf,
INT  buflen,
const InetSocketAddr *  to
)  [protected]
 

Writes data to the socket. For connectionless sockets (UDP) the to parameter may specify a destination address. If it is not specified, then the data is sent to the sockets default destination address previously established. For connection-oriented sockets (TCP) parameter to has to be 0.

Returns:
Number of bytes written or -1 on failure.

Reimplemented in UdpSocket.
